entry.title: problem connecting process automation with build app
entry.content:
Hi, 

I have build an business process automation, and created a destination 

sap_process_automation_service_user_access with following properties:

sap.cloud.service = com.sap.spa.processautomation

sap.cloud.service.alias = spa

saasregistryenabled = true

MobileEnabled = true

HTML5.DynamicDestination = true

CEP.EnableCsrfProtection = true

sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled = true

sap.processautomation.enabled = true

WebIDEEnabled = true

AppgyverEnabled = true

endpoints = blank

html5-apps-repo = blank

In the buildApp  App setting, BTP authentication is configured.   The process automation is released and published.  However, in the buildApp Integration section, the process automation is not shown.  Am I missing anything?  Is there anything else I need to set up/check?  I'd appreciate any guidance on the issue.  Thanks in advance.  

 

Lily

entry.title: Issue with File Corruption When Downloading from DMS via Build Process Automation
entry.content:
We are currently working on a Proof of Concept (POC) where we upload a file to the Document Management System (DMS) using a Form Trigger in SAP Build Process Automation (BPA). The upload process works as expected.

However, when we attempt to download the same file to a local system path using automation, the file downloads successfully, but the content appears to be corrupted and cannot be opened properly.

 

We have referred to the store template "Invoice Processing with Document Management Service" to create the process.

 

 

 

 

Has anyone encountered a similar issue or have any suggestions on how to resolve this? Any insights or best practices for handling file encoding or content integrity during upload/download in BPA would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How to grant access to a BPA service key client for invoking rule services in a custom environment?
entry.content:
I’m working with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) and trying to invoke a decision service using the public Rule Runtime API. Below is my setup:

Setup:

  • I created a BPA project and deployed it to a custom environment named test.

  • I created a service key for the BPA service instance.

  • I generated a JWT token using the clientId and clientSecret from the service key (grant_type=client_credentials).

  • I called this API:

     

    POST https://spa-api-gateway-bpi-eu-prod.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/public/rule/runtime/rest/v2/rule-services?environmentId=test

     Problem:

    I receive the following error response:

    {
  "error": {
    "code": "bpm.rulesruntime.error",
    "message": "User does not have sufficient privileges to access the environment.",
    "details": []
  }
}

    What I’ve Verified:

    • The rule is deployed and active in the test environment.

    • The JWT token is valid and includes expected scopes.

    • The request payload is correct.

    • If I deploy the decision to the public environment, the same request works successfully.

       

       Additional Observation:

      If I generate the token using grant_type=password (with my own username and password — I have BPA runtime access roles), the request works for the test environment as expected.

      So it seems like:

      • My user has the correct role collection assigned.

      • But the service key's clientId does not.

         

         Question:

        How can I grant the required authorities or roles to the BPA service key client so it can access the custom environment (test) via the runtime API?

        Is there a supported way to:

        • Assign a role collection to the service key’s technical client ID?

        • Or use grantedAuthorities to grant scopes like SPA_ADVANCED_USER or environment-specific access?

          SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: Multi Level Parallel Approval Workflow - SAP Build Process Automation on SAP BTP
entry.content:
We are implementing a workflow using SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) on SAP BTP, and we are encountering a challenge in designing a specific approval logic.
Below is the detailed requirement:

1. We have a condition at the beginning of the workflow to check whether: currentApprovalLevel <= highestApprovalLevel
2. If the above condition fails, the workflow should end immediately.
3. If the condition passes, the workflow should:
a. Send the approval form to two approvers in parallel at the current level.
b. If either of the approvers rejects, the workflow should end immediately.
c. Only if both approvers approve, then:
* Increment the currentApprovalLevel by 1.
* Loop back to the initial check (currentApprovalLevel <= highestApprovalLevel).
4. If the check passes, again continue the same process with the next set of approvers.
5.This should continue until the currentApprovalLevel exceeds the highestApprovalLevel.

FYI:
1. We are maintaining and extracting the approval levels, roles, email id's in hana db through capm application.
2. We have a task ui app where we designed an approval form.

I initially utilized the Branch concept within SAP Build Process Automation. I created two branches to send the approval form to two approvers simultaneously. However, I observed that once the approval form in Branch 1 is approved, the workflow proceeds to the next step without waiting for the response from Branch 2. This behavior is not aligned with our requirement, where the workflow should wait for both approvals before proceeding further.

@Archana @Dan_Wroblewski @Tamas_Hoznek

entry.title: Why can't I assign list or object values as outputs in Decision Tables in SAP BPA?
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (BPA), I'm defining a Decision with the following input/output structure:

  • Inputs:

    • Question (string)

    • Answer (string)

  • Outputs:

    • NextQuestion (string)

    • ProbableAnswers (array of strings) → for example: ["Yes", "No", "Maybe"]

Problem:

  • The output parameter NextQuestion appears in the Decision Table and I can assign values to it.

  • But the output parameter ProbableAnswers (array) does not appear at all in the Decision Table UI.

My Questions:

  1. Why does BPA Decision Table hide output fields that are of type array or object?

  2. Is there any way to assign structured outputs (like a list or object) from within a Decision Table?

  3. Is the only workaround to flatten everything into strings, or should I use a script task or external service to return complex objects?

What I Tried:

  • Defined the output type in the decision as:

    {
  "name": "ProbableAnswers",
  "type": "array",
  "items": { "type": "string" }
}

  • But the field is completely missing from the Decision Table output columns — I can't assign or return it.

SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: How can we store static data in SAP Build Process Automation and access it in a Decision Table?
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (BPA), I want to store a set of static configuration data — for example, a JSON file that contains a list of Yes/No questions along with next-step logic.

I understand that BPA allows uploading static artifacts like JSON files into the project, but:

 My Questions:

  1. Can I access this static JSON data from within a Decision Table?

  2. If yes, how can I reference or read that static file inside a Decision Table?

  3. Is there a recommended way to make BPA Decision Tables dynamically configurable using such static files?

 What I'm Trying to Do:

I want to avoid hardcoding all rows in the Decision Table. Instead, I’d prefer:

  • Storing a JSON or CSV file with the step-by-step rules

  • Having the Decision Table evaluate against that static data

  • Or programmatically update the table from that file (if possible)

Example JSON I want to use:

[
    {
        "step": 1,
        "question": "Is the requestor an employee?",
        "yesNext": 2,
        "noNext": "STOP"
    },
    {
        "step": 2,
        "question": "Is the budget approved?",
        "yesNext": 3,
        "noNext": "STOP"
    }
]
SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: SAP BPA API Trigger Job Expired
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm having a problem trying to execute several API Trigger in a row. Sometimes the last job is not executed and it ends with status Expired:

Each time it fails, these are the status through which the job is changing:

I looked for the Agent log in that instant and I found this error:

But according to the Agent, it was available at the time of this execution. It's always the last job that fails and if the API Trigger is called 3 times, it is supposed to stack these executions, so I don't know why it is not executing the last one.

 

The project is deployed in the Public Environment and the number of calls for the API Trigger varies.

Any idea?

Thanks experts.

entry.title: SAP IRPA/BPA Excel formulas not calculated when cell values set by bot
entry.content:
Hi, I am facing issue as per the subject. I need to pass dates from SAP to prepared excel where it does some calculations. When I enter the dates (to cells that are formatted as date), these excel formulas (instead of getting correct values) are giving me 04.01.1900. I thought it could be some format issue when taking data from SAP. But even when I try to get and manipulate values only within excel, it does the same. As a last resort I tried to reenter these formulas. So after I set cell B2 and C2 with date I put formula to column I2. result is still the same. When setting these B2, C2 cells as a user, everything gets calculated correctly. Is there any fix for that? Thank you.

Edit: looks like root cause is the format with formula combination. Formulas like =IF etc are calcaulted. Formula =MAX(D2:D16) not. I can see by testing the value inserted by bot with =ISNUMBER is false but when entered by human it returns true. So need to find out how to pass values to excel in correct format probably?

How can I add the filename of the screenshot taken as attachment? SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: SAP Business Process Automation with Document Information Extraction - extract data using AI
entry.content:
Greetings,

I am building a automation process and want to use the activity "Extract Data Using AL (Premium), reference can be found here IRPA SDK V2.

It is marked as Alpha, so I'm not sure what that means. I am using Document Information Extraction SDK version 1.75.21 (the latest) but this activity is not available within the SDK. 

Can you please let me know when it will be available as it is key to the process I am building. As we have many document types I do not want to extract based on a template. We do have DOX premium service to allow for gen AI extraction based on the schema only.

Many thanks in advance for your help, Adrian

entry.title: Build process automation RDP mode and limitations on mouse click in virtual environments
entry.content:
Hi,

I would like to know how to find out mouse click limitations that can never be done even when RDP is configured. We have virtual environment where bots are running during lots of SAP Gui, excel or outlook automations without any issues. Once there was a scenario with two excel subsequent pop-ups where buttons needed to be clicked (click sync) that worked only when user was connected looking at the session - probably these pop ups were not recognized when user disconnected. After configuring RDP based on this - to be honest not quite intuitive documentation: (https://help.sap.com/docs/intelligent-robotic-process-automation/desktop-agent-user-guide/manage-unlock-with-desktop-agent?locale=en-US) it started to work even without user connected to session. Therefore I assume RDP has been set up correctly.

Now we have UI5 automation that needs to perform Mouse Click. And this mouse click is never performed when user is disconnected. Therefore I am looking for some simple way how to either doublecheck RDP configuration or how to find out exact situation when mouse clicks are not possible in virtual desktops. As this only says "certain circumstances":

 

So I would like to know what are these "certain circumstances" as when customer asks for some use case, basically we dont know whether its gonna work in VM or not until whole scenario is finished. Only at the end we find out that some elements do not react on click but only to mouse click. Also when using application recorder, all the buttons are recorded as click and later we find out they only react on mouse click.

Many thanks to product experts @cherry_li, @Chaitanya_Priya for any advice.
